<<<<<<< HEAD
An epistolary poem to John Dryden, Esq. occasion'd by the much lamented death of the Right Honourable James, Earl of Abingdon / by William Pittis ... Pittis, William, 1674-1724.
[6], 9, [7] p.
Printed for H. Walwyn ..., London : 1699.
Reproduction of original in University of Michigan Libraries. The patentee, or, Some reflections in verse on Mr. R---'s [i.e. Christopher Rich's] forgetting the design of His Majesty's Bear-Garden at Hockly in the Hole (1700) -- A panegyrick on the author of Absolom and Achitophel (1682) -- An elely [sic] on the most celebrated poet of the age, John Dryden, Esq. (1700).
=======
An epistolary poem to John Dryden, Esq. occasion'd by the much lamented death of the Right Honourable James, Earl of Abingdon / by William Pittis ... Pittis, William, 1674-1724.
[6], 9, [7] p.
Printed for H. Walwyn ..., London : 1699.
Reproduction of original in University of Michigan Libraries. The patentee, or, Some reflections in verse on Mr. R---'s [i.e. Christopher Rich's] forgetting the design of His Majesty's Bear-Garden at Hockly in the Hole (1700) -- A panegyrick on the author of Absolom and Achitophel (1682) -- An elely [sic] on the most celebrated poet of the age, John Dryden, Esq. (1700).
H. Walwyn
